intro: Buchanania novohibernica, commonly known as the New Ireland Buchanania, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Ireland in the Bismarck Archipelago. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, large, palmate leaves, and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
